Math.tex: \displaystyle\hat{g}_{t}(\xi)=\int_{\mathbb{T}}g_{t}(x)e^{-i\xi x}dm(x)=\sum_{% k\in\mathbb{Z}}\int_{\mathbb{T}}k_{t}(x+2\pi k)e^{-i\xi x}dx=\sum_{k\in\mathbb% {Z}}\int_{\mathbb{T}}k_{t}(x+2\pi k)e^{-i\xi(x+2\pi k)}dx=\int_{\mathbb{R}}k_{% t}(x)e^{-i\xi x}dx=\hat{k}_{t}\left(\frac{\xi}{2\pi}\right)=e^{-\xi^{2}t}.
Math.text: (hat@(g)) _ t * xi = (integral _ T)@(g _ t * x * e ^ (- i * xi * x) * differential-d@(m) * x) = (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((integral _ T)@(k _ t * (x + 2 * pi * k) * e ^ (- i * xi * x) * differential-d@(x))) = (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((integral _ T)@(k _ t * (x + 2 * pi * k) * e ^ (- i * xi * (x + 2 * pi * k)) * differential-d@(x))) = (integral _ R)@(k _ t * x * e ^ (- i * xi * x) * differential-d@(x)) = (hat@(k)) _ t * (xi / (2 * pi)) = e ^ (- xi ^ 2 * t)

1 + (sum _ (k >= 1))@((exponential@((pi * k * x) / t) + exponential@(- (pi * k * x) / t)) * exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t))

para.p: the lower bound we wanted to prove.
Write

Math.text: S = 1 + 2 * (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t) * hyperbolic-cosine@((pi * k * theta) / t))

para.p:
For any
‚â• k 1

‚â§
| Œ∏ |

Math.text: 2 * hyperbolic-cosine@((pi * k * theta) / t) less= 2 * hyperbolic-cosine@((pi ^ 2 * k) / t) = exponential@((pi ^ 2 * k) / t) + exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k) / t) less= 1 + exponential@((pi ^ 2 * k) / t)

para.p: Hence

Math.text: S less= 1 + (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t) * (1 + exponential@((pi ^ 2 * k) / t))) = 1 + (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t)) + exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k * (k - 1)) / t) less= 1 + (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t)) + exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * (k - 1) ^ 2) / t) = 2 + 2 * (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t)) = 1 + square-root@(t / pi) * g _ t * 0

2 + 2 * (sum _ (k >= 1))@(exponential@(- (pi ^ 2 * k ^ 2) / t))
1 + square-root@(t / pi) * g _ t * 0

para.p:
T ‚àû
with the product topology is a compact abelian group. Let
m ‚àû
be Haar measure on
T ‚àû
:

Math.text: formulae@(d * m _ infinity * x = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(d * m * x _ k), x = vector@(x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots) element-of T ^ infinity)

para.p:
where
m
is Haar measure on
T
.

For

be the measure on
T

para.p:
This is a probability measure on
T
.

Let

(

N ‚àû

Math.text: (mu _ t) ^ A = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(mu _ (a _ k * t))

para.p:
This is a probability measure on
T ‚àû
. 2 footnote¬†2 2 footnote 2 Christian Berg determines conditions on
A
and
t
so that
Œº t
A
is absolutely continuous with respect to Haar measure
m ‚àû
on
T ‚àû
: Potential theory on the infinite dimensional torus, Invent. Math. 32 (1976), no. 1, 49‚Äì100.

The Pontryagin dual of
T ‚àû

‚äï

‚àû
Z

Z

T ‚àû

Math.text: e _ xi * x = exponential@(i * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(xi _ k * x _ k))

para.p:
The Fourier transform of
Œº t
A
is
:
‚Å¢ F
(
Œº t
A
)

Z
( ‚àû )

Math.text: formulae@(F * (mu _ t) ^ A * xi = (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(e _ (- xi) * x * differential-d@(m _ infinity) * x), xi element-of Z ^ infinity)

para.p: which is

Math.text: (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(e _ (- xi) * x * differential-d@(m _ infinity) * x) = (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(exponential@(- i * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(xi _ k * x _ k)) * differential-d@((mu _ t) ^ A) * x)
(integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(e _ (- xi) * x * differential-d@(m _ infinity) * x)
absent = (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(exponential@(- i * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(xi _ k * x _ k)) * differential-d@((mu _ t) ^ A) * x)
absent = (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(exponential@(- i * xi _ k * x _ k) * d * (mu _ t) ^ A * x))
absent = (integral _ (T ^ infinity))@(((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(exponential@(- i * xi _ k * x _ k) * d * (mu _ t) ^ A * x))
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ T)@(exponential@(- i * xi _ k * x _ k) * g _ (a _ k * t) * x _ k * differential-d@(m) * x _ k))
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ T)@(exponential@(- i * xi _ k * x _ k) * g _ (a _ k * t) * x _ k * differential-d@(m) * x _ k))
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((hat@(g)) _ (a _ k * t) * xi _ k)
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((hat@(g)) _ (a _ k * t) * xi _ k)
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(exponential@(- (xi _ k) ^ 2 * a _ k * t))
absent = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(exponential@(- (xi _ k) ^ 2 * a _ k * t))
absent = exponential@(- t * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a _ k * (xi _ k) ^ 2))
absent = exponential@(- t * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@(a _ k * (xi _ k) ^ 2))
